pull.title: net: Don't allow resolving of std::string with embedded NUL characters. Add tests.

events.body:
<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#17602](https://drahtbot.github.io/bitcoin_core_issue_redirect/r/17602.html) (net: Limit # of IPs learned from a DNS seed by family by dongcarl)
* [#17356](https://drahtbot.github.io/bitcoin_core_issue_redirect/r/17356.html) (RPC: Internal named params by luke-jr)
* [#17160](https://drahtbot.github.io/bitcoin_core_issue_redirect/r/17160.html) (refactor: net: subnet lookup: use single-result LookupHost() by theStack)
* [#16548](https://drahtbot.github.io/bitcoin_core_issue_redirect/r/16548.html) (Make the global flag *fDiscover* an instance variable of CConnman by mmachicao)
* [#16224](https://drahtbot.github.io/bitcoin_core_issue_redirect/r/16224.html) (gui: Bilingual GUI error messages by hebasto)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.
Concept ACK. It's best to not use C style Strings whenever it's possible, and if and when it's required we should add sanity checks.

utACK a32d3ccefe008f098f435a0b01284d5711ee8768

I always learn something new about implicit conversion in C++

rename.from: net: Don't allow resolving of std::string:s with embedded NUL characters. Add tests.
rename.to: net: Don't allow resolving of std::string with embedded NUL characters. Add tests.

events.body:
Concept ACK
Also gets rid of a lot of the remaining (unnecessary) `c_str()`.
This is something I've been wanting to do for a long time but never dared.

events.message: net: Avoid using C-style NUL-terminated strings as arguments in the netbase interface
tests: Add tests to make sure lookup methods fail on std::string parameters with embedded NUL characters
tests: Avoid using C-style NUL-terminated strings as arguments

events.body:
Rebased to get rid of non-related Travis macOS failure!

@promag @EthanHeilman Please re-review :)

ACK 7a046cdc1423963bdcbcf9bb98560af61fa90b37
I did not run any tests. I read through the code carefully, looking up behavior I didn't understand. I don't see any reasons not to merge.

ACK 7a046cdc1423963bdcbcf9bb98560af61fa90b37

> It should be noted that the ConnectThroughProxy change (from bool *outProxyConnectionFailed to bool& outProxyConnectionFailed) has nothing to do with NUL handling but I thought it was worth doing when touching this file :)

FWIW I think such unrelated changes should generally be avoided (especially as part of the same commit). But I don't mind it in this case, personally, and this has had enough review.

comments.body: Could also test with embedded nul char at end.
Good idea! Added such a case. Please re-review :)
nit, could drop the middle nul.
To me the middle `\0` seems like a useful case to check. Whats the benefit in dropping it?

You mean that the test for  `BOOST_CHECK(!LookupHost(std::string("127.0.0.1\0", 10), addr, false));` is the same as the test for `BOOST_CHECK(!LookupHost(std::string("127.0.0.1\0example.com", 21), addr, false));`?

It doesn't especially relevant to this PR so this should block this PR but I noticed that `proxyConnectionFailed` is not checked in this call Does it make sense to create a ConnectThroughProxy method without the `outProxyConnectionFailed` parameter or should this call check `proxyConnectionFailed` like the prior call does?
Good point! Let's we tackle that in a separate follow-up PR to keep this one focused :)
Agreed, I just wanted to make a note here so I didn't forget.
